Node.definition: = town; ◄ in Syria (אֲרָם) ► capital of one of the Aramaean (אֲרָם) kingdoms
= town; ◄ in Syria (אֲרָם) ► capital of one of the Aramaean (אֲרָם) kingdoms

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
read as לְעִי (עִי)
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= town; ◄ territory of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן)
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle
= action by which humans or animals assume a horizontal position, either to rest or to attack

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative action by which humans inspire a strong fear in (other) humans or animals, ► resulting in panic
= area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= town; ◄ in Syria (אֲרָם) ► capital of one of the Aramaean (אֲרָם) kingdoms
= land and ethnic group ◄ located in Syria; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which a prominent condition loses its prominence and becomes like its opposite
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose
= grain as it is growing on the field and awaiting harvesting; it burns easily; people can pluck the ears and eat the grains
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= causative action by which humans or animals bring together and take in objects from scattered places or sources
= crops that are left on the field after the harvest, ≈ sometimes used figuratively to denote the aftermath of an event

Node.gloss: beating (a tree to harvest its fruits)
Node.definition: = action by which humans insert a stick between the branches of an olive tree and thrash it back and forth, shaking the branches until most or all the olives drop off

= tree reaching up to 10 m. high, but usually pruned to around 5 m.; its leaves are grayish green above, and whitish underneath; its fruit is about 2 cm. long and a bit more than 1 cm. thick with a hard stone inside and a soft skin that covers the oily flesh; ► its fruit is used for food and oil for cooking, for lamps, for rubbing on the body, for medicine, and for anointing; ≈ regarded as beautiful and associated with well being
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= state in which a countable entity is three in number
= the ripe fruit of an olive tree
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= a secondary woody stem arising from the trunk or bough of a tree or the main stem of a shrub; also used as a collective
= state in which a countable entity is four in number
= state in which a countable entity is five in number
= process by which humans, animals, or plants produce much offspring, ► and so grow in number and strength
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= a pole, ◄ made of wood, ► representing the deity Ashera, and set up near the altar in a place of sacrifice
= construction with a flat top; ◄ probably made out of stone; ► used for burning incense; ≈ associated with non sanctioned worship

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place
= area with many trees
= a secondary woody stem arising from the trunk or bough of a tree or the main stem of a shrub; also used as a collective
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state
figurative extension of a rock as place of refuge: = deity that protects and provides refuge

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= state in which a plant has qualities that inspire appreciation
= part of a vine (גֶּפֶן) which grows out of the trunk or a bough
= state in which an object is considered as not belonging to a certain group of objects

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= causative action by which humans cause a plant to grow by giving it the care it needs
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
literally: seed; hence: = action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop

Node.gloss: heap (of water)|mass (of water)|small heap (of plant)|to flee
Node.definition: = a large quantity of water, staying together as one heap as if it were a solid substance|= a certain quantity of something, staying together in one place|= action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

Node.gloss: to be, become weak|to be, become powerless|to be sick|to be injured
Node.definition: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances
= state in which humans are physically wounded
= state in which someone has a very serious health condition; ► so that recovery is beyond expectation
= exclamation expressing emotion concerning suffering that will come over an individual or nation
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

literally: roaring; hence: = process by which a political entity, like a nation or kingdom, is in a state of unrest, often meaning that they are contemplating rebellion or planning to wage war; ◄ described in terms of the sound produced by turbulent waters
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language
= process by which turbulent waters produce a loud and intimidating noise
= state in which humans, deities or substances have great power and strength

= process by which a political entity, like a nation or kingdom, is in a state of unrest, often meaning that they are contemplating rebellion or planning to wage war; ◄ described in terms of the sound produced by turbulent waters
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language
= process by which turbulent waters produce a loud and intimidating noise
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

= process by which a political entity, like a nation or kingdom, is in a state of unrest, often meaning that they are contemplating rebellion or planning to wage war; ◄ described in terms of the sound produced by turbulent waters
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped

= any of several plants that commonly break from their roots at maturity and, drying into a rounded tangle of light, stiff branches, roll before the wind, covering long distances and scattering seed as they go; ≈ associated with things that lack weight and substance and do not endure
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

= the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed
= something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= something that happens to someone; ◄ whether or not as recompense for what he/she has done
= a pattern of events that someone will be involved in, described as an allotment from God, often as a consequence of one's life choices
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war
